description:
I'm trying to cut down on my coffee consumption, but Wrecking Ball makes that very difficult.

This place is so legit. The coffee is awesome, as is the selection of pastries.
author: Brian B.

description:
Currently my new gem for coffee shops. Tucked away in the Marina this place has both hipster vibes and great coffee.

Street parking is available. Limited seating inside, no tables. PINEAPPLE WALLPAPER, wow! So cute, nice background for that photo! 10/10 would reccomend. Fast customer service, not overly friendly, just ok. Prices are your average coffee shop prices $5-$6 but their cups are pretty big so it's worth (16oz i think)

For my drink I got my favorite Iced Mocha. Soooo good! The milk they used blended perfectly with their strong espresso and yummy chocolate. Not overly sweet, just right. Definitely want to try other items on their menu!
author: Michele G.

description:
Great coffee, great staff and polices, great part of town. 

You can buy beans from Marina Market if you want to start your day with a yummy cup of light roast coffee.
author: Rachel Z.

description:
Cute little coffeeshop that serves decent drinks and a variety of pastries.

I dropped by this shop after working out one weekday morning. There was only one other person in the store besides the staff, which meant it was quick to order and get my drink. As always, I got an almond milk latte.

The latte was nice and a good temperature for drinking immediately. In addition, I also got tempted by a scone-- it was ok, but not amazing.

While I was in and out pretty fast, I did take a note that the interior, while small, was cute. Definitely a place to catch up with a friend in the future!
author: Angela C.

description:
IG-worthy, petite, sleek cafe near the beautiful Lyon steps!

- Came for the first time on a Sunday afternoon. Love the photo-worthy pineapple interiors. (The aesthetic wall paper is even in restrooms)

- Overall ambiance is cozy, trendy, and urban. Very friendly staff who offers help when needed. 

-  Pastry was all sold out that afternoon (upon losing time), and not many options for non-caffeinated drinks available (besides hot chocolate)

- Products on the side (coffee beans, chocolate nutty treats, etc.) were average priced + a bit higher.

- Will come back to give this place another try!
author: Jess W.

description:
Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters make some good Lattes

Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters make some "DAMN" good Lattes

When it comes to espresso drinks, I rely heavily on quality and will not settle for Starbucks' garbage. 

The café was a cupcake place previously. In place is a roastery that sell their own line of coffee beans and use them in their beverages. This place is very small with minimal seating. With the Union Street corridor having many café's and coffee shops, this tiny place can get really busy in the early morning. 

I have been here a few times and every time I get the crafted lattes. For $5.00, the espresso was used by their own beans with whipped organic milk from Strauss creamery. You have to like that combination. The latte has a very flavorful taste of the coffee bean. I also loved the whipped steamed milk on top for a nice presentation. 

San Francisco is one of the top US cities with great coffee places. Wrecking Ball is top on that and my list.
author: Matt G.

description: A little uncomfortable when you walk in.  It's a long hallway and the baristas are just kinda standing there watching you.  BUT, after that.  It's wonderful. Incredible coffee. Beautiful interior.  No complaints at all. Really nice place to sit and work or read and sip on coffee.  That whole section on Union St. is really cool and has tons of cute coffee/food places.
author: Lisa O.

description: I love gourmet coffee and this place is soooooo good!!! The lattes are on point as well. Can't believe I'm just finding this place. Everyone needs to try it!!!! Good stuff for sure :)
author: Ali R.

description:
Don't worry.

They don't have the Miley Cyrus song playing on loop.  But I can't promise that you won't have it in your head at some point anyway...

The coffee is rich & strong.  All the usual suspects of a contemporary coffee joint are here; pour overs & non dairy milks, local artisan pastries (Marla Bakery), etc.  The baristas are first rate, though.  Highly knowledgeable & passionate, they love good coffee & it shows.  Any barista that can go toe to toe w my S.O. about brewing more than passes the test, & that's what happened here.

It's TINY.  There are no tables inside, just 3 chairs at the counter & shiny wood benches running the (very short) length of the shop.  So, it's not the environment that says hideout & work on your laptop.  And that is perfectly fine w me.  This city has plenty of places like that already.  You might have to actually talk to someone!  

Just like the old days.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Beautiful small coffee joint with great coffee. Love the ambiance and friendly service! Definitely has the friendly neighborhood feel and vibe. There are so many coffee shops around the same vicinity and so many choices! This place is small, simple, clean with no nonsense good coffee! Had their matcha latte and it was the best ever I've had! The way they make it for you is yet another story and so cool to see! Highly recommend you won't be disappointed!
author: June R.

description:
If I could give this place ten stars, I would! The coffee is wonderful, the food is delicious, and everyone there is super friendly. My personal favorite is the hot chocolate. It's absolutely divine, not super sweet or too bitter; The scones are a perfect way to start your day. 
Keep making wonderful coffee!!
author: Jasper-Mikhael R.

description: Good coffee, just no where to sit! Wonderful staff...liked the vibes, just didn't know how small it was when I chose to meet a friend here. We got a nice walk around the hood instead
author: J H.

description:
Super proud of you guys for standing up for what you believe in! It says so much that you chose to turn down the business from Salesforce because they provide services to U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

Love your coffee and will continue to be a happy customer! Keep on standing up for your values and brewing delicious coffee.
author: Mike P.

description: Best Mocha in SF. I've tried almost all the other coffee roasters in SF. No comparison. Staff/Baristas are awesome too.
author: hanzal M.

description: One of the best coffees I have had in San Francisco! I like my coffee freshly brewed with some cream and nothing else fancy and this one is totally kick ass! The flavors n aromas just burst out in the mouth when u take that first sip. I would love to give 5 stars but rating 4 because they don't warm up the cake for you. Great coffee needs to go with a great cake and for me that's warm cake.
author: Chinmayi V.

description:
Quality coffee and one of my favorites in the city!

This place is a cute little hole in the wall type shop with a few benches and two chairs next to where you can watch the baristas make pour overs.

I've gotten the Columbian and Ethiopian pour overs as well as their cappuccino and lattes. All were great and rich in flavor. The baristas were super laid back and friendly as well!

P.S. Don't forget to take a selfie with the pineapple wallpaper (:
author: Angela P.

description: Excellent cortado , hard to find something similar to Australian piccolo but they may have done it !
author: Matt S.

description:
drip coffee is on par with drips from four barrel, (b patisserie, who sells four barrel), st franks on polk

AKA the drip coffee here is really good - flavorful, light roast / acidic

Do i think it can get any better? Not sure. But I'm holding out on a 5 star coffee place until something really blows my mind.

The ambiance here is just ok. I find it overly yuppie and not low key enough.

Very intrigued in trying their matcha latte but it seems so overpriced at $6.50!
author: Jeanie N.

description: Wrecking Ball has some of the best beans hands down. I love wrecking ball just a bit more than Equator. They usually give my pup a biscuit when we come in and the facility is always very clean. Coffee is out of this world!
author: Kayla M.

description:
This is what I call a specialty coffee shop! :) My friend and I were hanging around the Marina, and decided to drop by Wrecking Ball. So glad we did. They source their own beans, and have all the top notch gear to make legit good coffee.

The pourovers are a bit higher priced, but for the quality they put into their coffee, I think they have good reason to price it higher. There were so many gadgets I had to ask the barista about all of them. Something I love is that they even measure their temperature accordingly when doing a pourover :) 

There isn't much seating, but if you want to watch the baristas work their magic, there is booth seating right in front of their pourover area. The baristas are also super friendly and helpful. I had a ton of coffee questions, and he was patient to answer them all. 

Wonderful coffee shop and will def be visiting when I'm back in the Cow Hollow area ;D
author: Jackie C.

description: This place is right across from where I work on the weekends - great vibes, awesome workers, and ps the savory scone is bomb when warmed up. Love this place!
author: Julia T.

description:
I'm so jealous on the people living in this neighborhood, so many great coffee selections. Wrecking ball that I discovered this morning certainly belongs to this elite group.

Tried cappuccino - this one is clearly something else. It was slightly less smooth, and more smoky, very easy to finish though. 

There was a huge wall with pineapple painting, make sure you snap a photo there!

P.S. Egg lovers, they serve hard boiled egg too.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Finally got to check out this little coffee shop and the coffee did not disappoint!

Small place, great for a coffee pick me up, feel free to sit at the benches by the wall if there's space, check out the infamous pineapple wallpaper for your IG needs.

Short but simple coffee menu with a few pastry selections. I'd recommend!
author: Ellie W.

description:
Minimalism on fleek. 

Minimal design + minimal seating + minimal menu = Minimal Review

Latte was good, service was good, will come again.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Got a matcha latte and iced mocha! Both were delicious! Friendly staff, clean. No place to work so was more of a grab and go! Recommend if you're walking around town!
author: Megan L.

description:
its a cool  and cozy and local coffee  shop. I am a regular coffee drinker and loved their dripped coffee . 
pour over is not on their menu but you can also try their pour over too :-)
author: Iman B.

description:
Stopped in this morning to get my iced almond milk latte.  Not going to lie, I had a huge sticker shock on the purchase price.  I always bring in my own cup as I like that it keeps my drink cold or hot longer than the other cups, it's also environmentally friendly.  After ordering my iced latte I was told it's $5.75.  My cup is not larger than what the latte will hold as I have used it at Reveille and Equator without a problem.  By far, this is one of the most expensive places to get coffee.  

I appreciate coffee that's not Starbucks and usually don't mind paying for it, but $6.00 is steep when I'm getting it elsewhere for $4.25 (with the almond milk). 

Overall, I like the coffee here and maybe other people don't mind not getting the cup discount or the steep price, but this will not be a regular type  visit to this place going forward for me.
author: J B.

description:
The drinks were good, but the service was lacking. I was really excited to check this place out since it has very good reviews. When we got there, however, the person working the cash register was unfriendly in response to our questions about the menu. We go out of our way to go to artisanal coffee shops, so it wasn't like we were trying to order a frappucino or something--just trying to get a feel for what they offer. When our first drink came out the barista handed it to us, but the second drink she put down on the table behind the bar instead of the bar itself or handing it to us, and didn't acknowledge when I said thank you. It can be intimidating to go to a new place, and we definitely felt like the odd ones out after our interaction with the employees.

There also is almost no seating, so this is not a good place to sit and relax with your coffee. This is totally understandable considering the lcoation, but just in case that is something you want, maybe this isn't the best option unless it is off hours.
author: Lizzie O.

description: Great coffee, even better ethical standards. Definitely worth paying a visit.
author: E E.

description: Small little coffee shop located in the Marina. We were spending the day in SF and definitely did not want to get Starbucks coffee. The shop is very adorable and well decorated. Very modern and has an open feeling despite the square footage. The drip coffee was very good and I liked how my mocha was not overtly sweet. Not too much space to sit and hang. One unisex bathroom. Street parking. Would come again.
author: Sarah C.

description: Finally, a cup of coffee which satisfies both my taste buds and ethics. I enjoy coffee without sugar and milk, as our good Lord intended. I learned from a coffee producer friend from Honduras, that black coffee can only be fully appreciated when the best beans are used. Something tells me this is the case with Wrecking Ball. Piping hot cuppa Joes just like the ones I've enjoyed in Guatemala & Honduras. Very appropriate, as they use their wrecking ball against those who make separation of Central American families possible. Go grab yourself an ethical, delicious cup!
author: Xiomara C.

description: Great coffee AND making a stand for humans of any color and origination, by turning down a $$$$$ contract from Salesforce who  are providing "service=approval" to CBP and their inhumane border policies.
author: dean b.

description:
This is a cute little hole in the wall coffee shop. The pineapple print wallpaper makes it pop and photo worthy. The inside looked and felt clean making it enjoyable to sit inside or outside of the shop. 

 We got a pour over from Kenya and a latte. Both were very tasty. The staff was super friendly and the line went quick. We went on a Saturday afternoon around noon and didn't have to wait long at all. I will definitely go back in the future.
author: Susan M.

description: Incredibly disappointed that yet another coffee shop opens up when we have far too many anyway and there is little to differentiate them from Starbucks. The quality and service were substandard.  Sadly the low quality is nowhere near matched by the extreme attitude we were greeted with upon arrival. I will continue to frequent Blue Bottle and Double Barrel happily while I watch this place go down and flames like all the rest.
author: CT M.

description: I've been enough times and it's consistently great. My favorite spot so far in SF. Not for everyone, as San Francisco natives tend to like fairly bright coffee. Wrecking Ball is definitely in the sweet spot of medium coffee, which is my particular taste.
author: Bernard F.

description: Fantastic coffee and more importantly fantastic philosophy. Mad props for doing what they believe is right vs the almighty dollar
author: Ottis M.

description:
If you're like me, you'll know you just can't have too many coffee shop reviews.

So here's another five star coffee shop that absolutely deserves every bit of that Yelp Red we all know and love. 

The shop is discreet, straightforward. No BS or unnecessary fluff to get in the way of you and your caffeine fix. 

*Outstanding*

You're literally in and out. Grab a danish, croissant or cookie if you're in the feels for all that. If you got time, snag a seat on their bench along the side, outside or cop a seat at the coffee bar and chat with the baristas. Loveeeee it. They keep you up on your coffee game while you watch a pour over. Ever. So. Slowly.

But whatevs, don't do all that. You'll enjoy your visit anyway. You'll enjoy the coffee that's for sure. 

Trust me on this.
author: Cat V.

description: I really like the vibe this place has it's pretty chill. It's almost like a little house and I don't know, it's really cool it feels homey if that makes sense. I had a mocha coffee or something, I forgot what it was called but to be honest it wasn't that good. Maybe it's just me but like I really didn't like it. I don't know why, but it just wasn't good. The cookie or brownie, or whatever I ate, was good though.
author: Josh B.

description:
Hmmph. Techy thermostat but coffee's not hot? Makes me more sad than disappointed.. I'm a little drained on the whole Me v the Perfect Cup of Coffee thing, but it wasn't mugged here. Most drinks are served in their signature Wrecking Ball Cup. Good for snaps against their white room and pineapple station, but what else?

I guess it's a "cute shop". It's minimalist. The people are inviting and non-pretentious--one of them even asked about the "Boosts Shoes" I was kickin around that wet day. 

I've had better coffee but then again, maybe I should be asking for my Mochas/cafe with milk to come "hot", even "extra hot" from now on. I'd return to try their cappuccino & pour overs.
author: Jason A.

description: Cute, dog friendly coffee shop with hand poured coffee. My almond milk latte was great! They have a small selection of breakfast pastries. The mini chocolate chip cookie was great!
author: Anjali P.

description: The fourth of five coffee roasters we tried on our recent trip to SF did not disappoint. Being a smaller and less well known roaster (at least outside of SF), I did not quite know what to expect from Wrecking Ball, but was very pleased with the Colombia Monteblanco (Pink Varietal) I ordered. The barista was also very fun to chat with. Overall, an absolute 5 star experience.
author: Ricky P.

description:
We couldn't make it to the city to support you for your awesome statement so we purchased a pound of Ethiopia Classic Yirgacheffe mail order. Very nice roast, all kinds of flavors going on there. Good enough to drink straight up. I wouldn't add anything to it unless it was a little Irish whiskey, sugar and a float of heavy cream. 
Well done Wrecking Ball, respect.
author: Edward H.

description: Really bad experience here, the latte I ordered was bizarrely sour, like really sour! The server named Nick was really rude and apathetic, and it was quite expensive. First time, last time
author: Rhombus K.

description:
To be honest...the name of this place really attracted me... Super glad it did, the iced coffee was great.

This place is a real hole in the wall *you'll see why when you go*. 
There is limited seating and the location isn't that large, I think there could be no more then 10-15 people in there at one time. But to be honest, this place is a place you would see on Instagram or something. The place is good for photo's *because of the pineapple walls and the coffee . 

I would recommend this place for its coffee *only tried iced* and for the pictures you can take. Only downside is that i wish there was more seating, but I will come again when i'm in the SF!
author: Joshua O.

description:
Thank you Wrecking Ball for opening a quality coffee place on this stretch of Union St. Starbucks is great for a venti mango black iced tea, but I betcha you passed by this place a hundred times and completely missed it. Let the simple white sign guide you into the treasure trove for the caffeine lover. (Pillowfight Espresso beans, fancy chocolates and even fancier coffee brewing accessories) 

Stop it. I know I'm not a coffee drinker. But on the times I find myself on Union St. itching to walk the entire neighborhood browsing shops and people watching, I want to drink something good. That something good I had here was a decaf latte. Deliciously smooth and not needing any sugar. YAAASSS. You can now put your head in your hands and scream "WHY did she get decaf?!" ;-)

I love the all white space with the cool pineapple wallpaper (perfect for snapchat selfies, right?) and the minimalist coffee bar area. However minimalist, you'll notice they take their craft seriously: weighing scales for the beans, water thermostat set at 209 degrees and a sexy La Marzocco machine. RAWR. 

As much as I love the Mission and it's hottest restaurants/bars/coffee shops, sometimes, I just don't want to deal with hipsters. Here you'll get the neighborhood folks dressed in their best lululemons and perfect looks even though they just "came" from Soulcycle. Don't hate, just appreciate and drink that amazing cup of joe.
author: Janice C.

description: Tiny little hipster coffee shop off Fillmore with the cutest pineapple wallpaper. Oh yeah, the coffee was pretty good too :) alternative milk options are limited, but sweet spot with really friendly baristas.
author: Phyllis C.

description:
I never knew pineapples n coffee went so well together til I came upon this special little coffee shop. one of the best things in the city is good coffee n I'm SO happy San Francisco has no end to making a cup of well-crafted joe.

Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters is located on Union Street in the Cow Hollow district of San Francisco. parking is mostly metered street parking. we usually have no trouble finding parking on the weekends in that area unless there's some kind of festivity going on. 

for a small hole in the wall coffee shop, this place is just too cool n definitely fit for hipsters. the sign on the wall by the entrance is simply a sketch of a wrecking ball with the word "coffee" on the bottom. the walls r covered in pineapples. (Hawaiian chic anyone? I'm going to wear a Hawaiian shirt n sit there next time just to b ironic.) 

I ordered myself a cappuccino n waited in the short hallway. I watched the male barista as he made a pour-over for the customer ahead of me. it was a beautiful "performance." I almost clapped. : ) 

my cappuccino was strong n delicious. sitting outside by the entrance, sipping away on that sunny day. a perfect chill afternoon.
author: Julie W.

description: Coffee is good and the atmosphere is cool! The workers are very nice, the service is good, they play good music, etc. I like the decor as well, the only thing I would say is that their coffee isn't super strong and their shop is very small.
author: Daniel C.

description: This small cafe was a wonderful escape from the busy street outside....the staff was so helpful and cheery - they introduced us to a cortado which was delicious and we tried for the first time (I know coffee amateurs but we're learning!). They even took a photo for us....great coffee, not a lot of indoor seating. Very hip
author: Shan And Marko X.

description:
Cute spot- average coffee.

I think this is a slightly over hyped, overrated cafe.
I would like to point out that the staff at this location are friendly and welcoming and if it wasn't for them I don't think I would come back again.

I would not recommend this place to coffee lovers, but if you do stop by I would their matcha latte.

The baked goods offered are also pretty good, and I appreciate them for selling "Compartes" chocolate - a good way to get me to stop by.
author: Liza P.

description:
Coffee done right! This tiny space on Union St. has never let me down and I continue to head back because they make proper coffee drinks on the regular. If you live in Cow Hollow, you've probably driven by here many times and not even noticed because it's basically a small window with a hanging sign above. 

The first thing I always notice is the water thermostat on the wall set to 209 degrees, so right off the bat you know they are using precision for their drip coffees. The multiple scales at the bar ensure you're getting the right weights for coffee grounds too. 

I generally order espresso because I can't make it well at home, and it's always superb. It's acidic, bold and the head is nice and light. I'm pretty sure they don't roast anything in house but, rather offsite. I'd love to see that process because of the few bags of beans I've purchased they have always tasted great at home too. Super friendly service, quick and a great morning stop!
author: Benjamin F.

description: I'm not even sure there was coffee in my latte. It legitimately tasted like steamed milk. I went with a friend and his iced coffee was a little better, but still tasted heavily of milk as opposed to coffee. Do they only put half a shot of espresso in their drinks? Maybe the drip coffee is worth it, but I will not be wasting another $5 to figure it out how this place has 3 stars, let alone 4.5.
author: Susan W.

description: Unpretentious, despite taking their coffee seriously. I had the most glorious latte of all time, and a tasty savory scone!
author: Liz W.

description: The coffee was sub-par and doesn't even compare to blue bottle. My coffee tasted slightly burnt and it just wasn't that complex. Wish I had saved my $.
author: Benjamin A.

description: Love Wrecking Ball. Great coffee and location in the neighborhood. Wish they had a bike share station nearby so it was easier for us to go there more often. Check it out!
author: Patrick T.

description: awesome service and great beans (pillowfight espresso). love the wed a.m. morning shift
author: Sameet M.

description:
SF is a major hub for awesome coffee made well and wrecking ball is definitely not an exception.

In the hustle and bustle of The Marina, Wrecking ball is a small, quaint, coffee shop that knows how to make a delectable cup of joe. There's a 3 small 2 people tables outside, perfect for people watching and catching up with your pals and a long bench inside. Although prices are meh, $5 for a cup, it's pretty standard for SF prices. 

My friend got a skinny latte and i opted for the Karl, a signature drink of theirs. It's an almond milk latte, with cardamon, honey and some other spices. Very well made, great flavors, nutty, smokey, and not too sweet. 

I would definitely come back here for a nice cup of coffee event though it's on the pricier side and enjoy the atmosphere. They're also infamous for their adorable pineapple wallpaper (all the blogger girls take a photo in front of this for their instragram). Over, lovely experience, but do remember that seating is limited and it's not a place to go hang/chill for a long period of time with your laptop.
author: Diane T.

description:
[Out-of-Towner Review]

Blogger heaven!

The infamous pineapple wallpaper is why most people go here. Others go for the coffee, but really, it's for a selfie with the wallpaper. You aren't a legit blogger, unless you get a selfie here ;)

Okay, well, at least that's why I went. The coffee was just a bonus. I ordered a Soy Mocha and the staff generously told me the granache they use has some dairy in it, but I ordered it anyways. $5 for my drink, which is pretty on par with Sacramento -- so I'm used to these boughie coffee spot prices!

Selife and coffee, my whole day trip to the City was complete!
author: Steph G.

description: This place is such a cute coffee shop!! Got a cortado for the first time and it was delish! Definitely more of a grad-and-go location than a sit down one!! The pineapple walls are definitely instagrammable too!
author: Connie Y.

description: Great little place! One of the best lattes in town hands down!
author: Tina B.

description: Great coffee, people and the courage to stand by their convictions on keeping families together at considerable business risk. My highest recommendation.
author: Jason O.

description: My friend and I love coffee and looking for new coffee shops and we found this one. It's little but so cute with pineapple wallpaper (photo ready). The guy taking our order was sweet and I ordered an oat milk latté and my friend ordered a regular one. Both delicious and just a great experience with a pretty ambiance. Expensive but worth it.
author: Selena H.

description: More like a grab-and-go location because of its size, BUT for the few minutes you're in there... the wallpaper is absolutely stunning to stare at and of course take pictures for your instagram lol. I ordered a cap and it was like what every lady should be -- strong and beautiful. hehehehe?
author: Elysse P.

description:
I heard about Wrecking Ball coffee and their entire process on a Joe Rogan podcast months before this storefront was opened. It was such an enlightening and eye-opening podcast about everything regarding the art form of coffee. The interior is very chic and artistic. Needless to say, the coffee is excellent. One of the best and smoothest cappuccinos I've ever had.
I mean, even if you don't drink coffee, you know you want a selfie with that pineapple wallpaper!!
author: Tuwie N.

description:
This place is great! The vibe is nice and chill. Staff is friendly and hip.

Coffee taste delicious.
author: Chris M.

description:
Oh. My. Gosh.  New favorite local coffee shop.

Right off the bat - props for making almond milk lattes.  I know that's growing in popularity, but it still hasn't caught on mainstream and people just don't know what they're missing out on.  

Anyway, moving along....  The space is adorable.  I love the fun wallpaper from Rifle Paper Co.  So many coffee shops are so masculine and/or industrial - it's nice to see them having a bit of fun.  Especially since the rest of the space is actually SUPER space age-y - they have SO MANY cool coffee gadgets.  It's really fun to see them get so precise and scientific about things!

They have a pretty legit selection of snacks, but their hardboiled eggs are the bomb.  Yes, they're a little expensive for just being boiled eggs.....but it's SO NICE to be able to get something other than sugary pastries.  When I went last weekend with a little hangover, these eggs saved my life.  I actually saw a guy go in and wait in a decently long line for coffee....just to buy half a dozen eggs and nothing else.

Now, to the pièce de résistance...their seasonal beverage, Karl the Latte.  This is the BEST coffee drink I've ever had.  It was fancy green tea plus two shots of espresso plus almond milk plus honey plus cardamom plus cocoa powder (the latter sort of just being dusted on top).  The drink was simultaneously sweet and savory.  Like a coffee rubbed barbequed meat plus chocolate cake.  I know I'm probably making it sound disgusting, but it was straight up the best drink ever.  I want to go back for me, like, ASAP.

I'm going to go map out how long it'll take me to walk here on Saturday.  #LOVE
author: Tay H.

description: My favorite coffee shop in SF. Solid cup of coffee!!  give it a shot!!  I love the cappuccinos, vibe is always on staff is hip and friendly music is great!!
author: Lylie H.

description: Coffee here tasted great! It is a bit overpriced, I ended up paying $4 for a cup of black coffee. It's a small space, but I like the vibe. The employees were friendly. Also, there is some nice outdoor seating. If I'm in the area, I can see myself stopping by again.
author: Lillian K.

description: Stopped in for a cortado and a chocolate croissant.  Small place with minimalist design - both the coffee and the pastry were delicious.  Glad I stumbled upon this spot - I will definitely be back.
author: Tyler T.

description: Love the ambiance here. Very black and white, minimalistically feminine, with accents of a pineapple wallpaper. They sell stationery, whole bean coffee, and Japanese coffee-making products in their retail section. The staff here seems to have fun with each other and is friendly and patient as you make your coffee selection. The pillow fight espresso is a tad on the sour side, but what do you expect for SF coffee?
author: Christina G.

description:
The minute you walk in you know you're in for an interesting experience. This location is a dash and go place. There's a long wall bench along the side with cool pineapple wallpaper, which makes for a great photo op. Outside, you'll see 5 chairs and a small table. 

Although it's a small space, it's still pretty clean and enjoyable. I ordered a pour over which cost $5, a little steeper than BB or ritual, but nevertheless it was a good cup of coffee. 

Spoke with the barista about their roastery, and staff overall seemed welcoming, and not snobbish. Overall I love the space and will want to try their other selections if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Brian L.

description:
Small little coffee spot in the Marina. And when I say small, I really do mean small. There's barely any seating, so don't expect to be able to work here and plan on getting coffee to go. I loved the clean, simple, minimalist look here.

I dropped by for some coffee and ended up getting a shot of espresso for $3.25, which is pretty standard for SF, but wasn't a big fan. It was too acidic/sour for my liking and I didn't find it strong enough. I loved the spot itself though so might get just coffee next time I'm around.
author: Jessie L.

description:
This place is a cute destination spot...

I'm only writing this review for the cold brew, but I feel like it wasn't strong enough.

It's so cute inside though and I'd definitely come back to try something else!
author: Anastacia W.

description: It takes a lot for me to feel compelled to write a Yelp review, but the Pillow Fight coffee beans from Wrecking Ball are the best I've tried, period. I make Aeropress coffee at home and for a long time settled on Philz darker blends (Julie's Ultimate, etc.). In short, Wrecking Ball has wrecked Philz for me. I cannot comment on WB's in-store drinks but if you make Aeropress or drip coffee at home, do give the Pillow Fight beans a try.
author: Brian M.

description:
This is a great to go coffee shop in the Cow Hollow/ Pacific Heights area. The prices here for coffee were a bit on the steeper side ($4-5 for a pour over??) so I decided to share a cup with my brother. The employees here are friendly and are surprisingly not snobby. Sorry I dont know why I think they would be, but good thing they werent :p

This store is really small and doesn't offer much seating other than the small outdoor chairs and tables. The interior I would say is quite cozy and cute. The pineapple wallpaper adds a nice touch to the shop. They have a few seats near the counter where you can actually see them making your coffee etc which is kinda cool.

Might stop by again if I am ever in the area.
author: Kenneth L.

description: Great quality coffee. I would recommend the almond milk latte/cappuccino or the slow pour coffee
author: Kevin K.

description: This place was smashing, unexpected - 4/5 almond milk latte w Califa barista blend milk and their own brand beans. Friendly and skilled barista crew, clean small space, no wifi, great tunes. Top 5 in SF for me.
author: Bharat W.

description:
Cool, TINY place. Very small inside and very hipster (which I love). It's dark, not much natural light, but great color scheme and fun wallpaper.

Deliciously made lattes and delightful chocolate chips cookies! I haven't tried their other sweet treats but they all looked great! Overall really good but expensive for what you get..
author: Lori T.

description:
Three cheers for medium roast coffee!  And good branding too.  

If you don't like the trendy bright citrus, and what to me are sour, flavors of light-roast coffee then this is the place for you.
author: Dan B.

description: Unimpressed with the mocha. Very little coffee or cocoa flavor. Almost just a glorified cup of steamed milk.
author: Lauren S.

description: Good Cappuccino $4! I like here. Smell good, cute store. The place is pretty small but interior was really cute. I took a lot of pics in there while I was waiting for my cappuccino.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: Prices are appropriate for this area. $4 for a large coffee, $4 for a pain au chocolate, $2.75 for a small 3"x3"x3" scone. I'm fine with paying $4 for a cup of coffee, but I honestly was not very impressed by the coffee they were serving today. I drink Philz everyday and this coffee, while not offensive or bad, was just very average. The atmosphere was very sleek and "hip", although there there wasn't very much seating inside (I guess they did the best they could with the space). In short, weak subpar coffee, hip, pricey, not much seating. Future pass.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Small coffee shop down the quieter end of union street. Outside there are small tables to sit at and inside there is some bar seating. But most of the time I come here before or after my journey into the unknown (so... takeaway).

The coffee is tasty and the service is always fast and friendly. The also have good music playing, so far I have been able to get down and bogey with The Unicorns and Strokes while waiting for my cappuccino.
author: Tristan L.

description:
Another lovely unassuming coffee shop in SF. Wrecking Ball is a very, very tiny store (very little seating room, so get your coffee to go). They've got wonderful spunky pineapple wallpaper, a mad science like laboratory for coffee creations, and otherwise minimalist design. The SO and I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon as we were taking a walk through Cows Hollow and wanted a caffeine refill. 

Prices are about what you would expect for coffee in the city ($4 range). I got a latte, and thought it was pretty well done. I never know how to review lattes. Milk to espresso ratio was fairly well done, not too much foam, and definitely tasted like quality. I don't know if it was the most delicious latte I've ever had, but it was certainly quite good. 

tldr; good little place to get coffee, but the store is pretty small so I would recommend getting it to go!
author: Jasmine X.

description: The service was soooo slow, and the staff was a little rude. When I tried to let them know I was in a rush, as I had to get back to work for a meeting, I got sassed. There are ample coffee shops in San Francisco and because of the speed and rudeness Wrecking Ball has lost me.
author: Alexander S.

description:
I came in like a wrecking--wait, someone's done that review already? Okay, I'll stop.

I don't quite understand why Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters isn't a bigger deal yet. It's run by Trish Rothgeb, who, outside of being a licensed Q-Grader and a Q-Trainer (among many other accolades), also supposedly (if you believe all the gossip coming out of the coffee vine) has the uncanny ability to tell what blend/roast outcomes will be like just by simply smelling the beans.

Her partner in crime, Nicholas Cho, is on the Board of Directors for the SCAA (the people that grade potential Q Graders, the ones that set the standards, etc.) and also the Board for the World Barista Championships (the competition that brought us Paul Bassett, Tim Wendelboe, et al.)

So, with some of the world's foremost experts on the handling, roasting, blending, and serving of coffee backing it up, Wrecking Ball should easily be able to serve up some of America's best--no, the planet's best coffee, and I really think it does. Another coffee enthusiast friend (who informed me of this establishment's existence) and I stopped here on a sunny Marina/Cow Hollow afternoon after a hefty Dim Sum lunch. I ordered the Guatemala Huehuetenago and he got the espresso, and the Kalita pour-over of the former (an interesting choice in a market that seems to be over-saturated with Hario and Chemex) probably was my eureka! coffee moment.

It's hard to describe the momentary bliss I felt with the first sip of my Guatemala, as the following sips were just as delightful, if not more interesting than the first--before I tried the the pour-over at Wrecking Ball, it had never crossed my mind that the flavor and the bouquet of coffee could change so drastically even with the slightest difference in serving temperature (try it next time--take a sip when the coffee is piping hot, a minute after that, and two minutes after that)

I will never see coffee the same way after that fateful afternoon on Union St. You could even say that it wrecked me. Yeah it, wre-eh-ecked  me.
author: Scott S.

description:
Not sure if this is something to be proud of, but I'm the biggest pineapple fan you'll probably meet. I have pineapple wallpapers, phone covers, desktop wallpapers...I even dressed up as a pineapple for Halloween. So, obviously, I came here for the pineapple wallpaper.

Jokes aside, coffee was great (I judge a cafe by the quality of its black coffee and the pour over was amazing, despite the steep price), baristas were friendly, space / ambience was lovely (also a huge sucker for "space"). Only criticism I have is that this is definitely your grab-n-go coffee shop or a sit-uncomfortably-n-sip coffee shop. There's hardly any room to sit and definitely no room to read or work.
author: Gina T.

description: This and saint frank are my favorite coffee shops in the city. It used to be blue bottle until they went way down hill. Love this place.
author: Captain B.

description: This is an awful "coffee shop". Please avoid on all counts. Went in there this morning at 7:30 am for a cup of coffee. The service was unbelievably rude. The barista told me they didn't have coffee and when I asked for espresso with skim milk she handed me 2% and said the words, I kid you not, "you'll survive". Please do not give your hard earned money to a place that has so little respect for its business or customers. They are many other wonderful places on union st - count this one out.
author: Ali S.

description:
pricey, totally hipster, but the pineapple wallpaper gives that away immediately so what more could you really expect?

i'll keep it short and sweet - order the cold brew on a warm indian summer afternoon. don't ruin it by adding any cream or sugar. just sip and enjoy. and don't forget to straighten your fedora on the way out.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Wrecking Ball, not to be confused with a Miley Cyrus track, is the epitome of why I believe in walking when you're in a new city. My introduction to this cafe's stark white walls and Rifle Paper Co feature wall is the direct result of "just passing by." 

Having walked and made my way to Union Street I noticed this nook and wandered in. Met by a friendly face, a filter coffee was ordered and I sat by the bar to chat to the baristas as orders were processed. It reminded me of cafes at home in Australia and the wait as my filter was brewed was worth it. The Guatemalan beans I'd been recommended certainly were everything described. As I sat and sipped my coffee, chatting, checking Yelp for where I wanted to venture next, I was left to my own devices and never made feel like I needed to rush along. 

It is the kind of cafe I can imagine myself frequenting after weekend yoga or SoulCycle classes if I were local. Like Nadia V said, this place is the real deal and I just hope that if I make it back to San Francisco next year they're still here for a return visit.
author: Lani P.

description:
This was a very modern-looking place. The ladies working were sort of quiet, but all very polite and attentive.

I ordered a Cortado, Croissant, and  hard-boiled egg. The Cortado was pretty tasty, but was not hot, only mildly warm. The croissant was amazing, having gotten it first thing in the morning. The egg was just a typical HB egg, but it was good too :)

One gripe about this place is that there aren't any tables inside, only a ledge-sort of seating area along the wall. It made eating the egg a little awkward. With all the coffee spots in the area, I wouldn't make a special trip to this place.
author: Daniel B.

description: Best almond milk latte I've had in a very long time! Loved the ambiance and outside seating. Will definitely be back!
author: Paul T.

description: I'm all about supporting small businesses, so I wanted to give this place a try instead of a big chain coffee shop. But I was disappointed by the unfriendly staff. This place is modern and cool, Coffee was good but I don't think I will go back for another bad service.
author: J S.

description:
Highlights
- That wallpaper tho! They have the most adorable wallpaper and even sell matching patterned greeting cards from Rifle Paper Co. Stepping inside makes me happy!
- Amongst their coffee offerings, they sell pastries, boiled eggs, gourmet chocolate bars, Wrecking Ball bags of coffee, Rifle Paper Co. stationary, and fancy Japanese coffee brewing tools. 
- They don't mess around here, quality ingredients that you can taste and everything is meticulous weighed/crafted.  
- $5 for my cup of mocha. Pretty steep for a small cup, but you can definitely taste the quality gourmet chocolate and the focus on the coffee, if that's your thing. None of that overly sweet artificial tasting syrup stuff here. 

Improvements
- I stopped by Sunday afternoon and there was a line to order as well as a wait time for your coffee. 
- it's a tiny place, there are only a few chairs near the coffee making bar area, the rest are seats along a wall without tables where patrons sit when they wait for their coffee orders, and a few tables with chairs outside. 

Tips
- Metered street parking or neighborhood parking.
author: Tracy T.

description: Visited this place on Sunday when visiting the lovely city and it is such an adorable place in an adorable area. They make the smoothest breve latte I've ever tasted! Super delicious, and awesome wallpaper, obviously :) Definitely want to visit again. Parking is rough.. prepare to probably park a block or so away and walk there, but it's worth it!
author: Sheila L.

description:
I feel like everyone goes to Wrecking Ball for the wallpaper. It just screams Instagram me! That being said, they have quite delicious coffee as well. While the seasonal items sound really cool, don't get your heart set on them as the menu is limited usually. I enjoy their cappuccinos with almond milk while my husband gets the iced cappuccinos. Both are super yummy and are really fun to Instagram in front of the pineapple wallpaper. 

Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters is right on Union Street in prime Pac Heights shopping. I recommend breakfast at Rose's across the street, then pick up a coffee at Wrecking Ball for your next shopping spree!
author: Kari G.

description: Minimalist interior, relatively little seating, great coffee. A Lululemon employee once enthusiastically recommended this place to me when I asked for coffee shops nearby, describing it as "gourmet coffee." They do have an excellent cortado. I also really enjoyed their hot chocolate last time I came here. Lack of wifi is kind of a bummer (it's a small cafe so I wouldn't really expect it) but I'm always willing to drop by when I'm near the Marina.
author: Ava H.

description: I have had a couple macs here which were excellent.  And, I have gotten a couple bags of beans for my Aeropress.  Very knowledgeable staff.  The macs were each different, but, both were as good as it gets.  If you are a coffee geek, search this place out.  Even if you just appreciate good coffee drinks, check it out.  Nice area of Union St.  Not too far off 101 if traveling through.  Quieter part of Union so even though limited parking, you have a better chance of finding something in that area.
author: Mike S.

description:
Love cute coffee shops.
Love the decor and hipster-ness of the place.
Also love Union street for shopping and good eats.

Now, I don't mind the drip coffee here (although tastes like every other drip coffee joint in the city), but the specialty drinks are pretty bad. I got their special latte, Karl, with honey and a few other spices. I had to throw it out after a few sips because it tasted that bad. If i had to describe it, i would say it tasted like drinking burnt wood. I don't know what they had it in but it does not work. Not sure who approved that for selling.

I will go back if i am ever in the area for the drips and maybe even some of the chocolates that they sell.
author: Cicely T.

description: I had a really great cold brew coffee here, and the best part is that the creamer and simple syrup were served in cute, little personal carafes! Everything inside was sleek, clean and white except the awesome pineapple wall!
author: Danielle A.

description: Such an adorable minimalist coffeeshop! I love the white walls and white countertop, accented with the sections of famous pineapple wallpaper. My friend took me here for some afternoon coffee. Very classy Cow Hollow feel to it - excellent service and coffee. No complaints here. Would recommend stopping by if you're in the area! Plus, it's called WRECKING BALL Coffee Roasters. How can you not?
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I guess another thing I do not enjoy besides a sour espresso drink is a burnt tasting one. My cortado was cute but it tasted like the coffee beans were burnt.

The pineapple wallpaper is cute. 
And the service was pretty good.
author: Heejin L.

description: Such a cute hole in the wall place. If you're ever in this area and you are a coffee fiend, then you've got to try this place! Staff is super friendly and atmosphere is relaxed. They are used to people taking pictures of their pineapple wallpaper so they don't care if you want to go ahead and take that selfie. Coffee is strong!!! I had their espresso and it was super acidic but a perfect morning wakeup. They also have the option of almond milk!! Overall, came with high expectations, left with them all fulfilled.
author: Dani D.

description: Solid coffee and good chocolate croissant. Limited seating - not a place to meet with friends but rather a grab and go location.
author: Hikaru Y.

description: This is the best dang darnit coffee shop in the city. i luuuuuv it so much and the employees and everything icludijg the pineapples on the walls. highly recomend to peprls lukin for coffee thats good tastetinfg. love you guys thanks
author: Ana L. B.

description: Favorite coffee spot in SF primarily because of the beans I buy and use at home, but their in house cortados are delicious too!
author: Lisa F.

description: I came for the specialty drink and was disappointed they just offer the classics (mocha, cappucino, latte, etc.). But the espresso is delicious and my drink was made well so can't complain! Pastries looked good too (but didn't try one myself).
author: Marilynn L.

description:
Wow.  This place should be a Mecca for coffee aficionados. If you come here the first time, definitely go for their market priced pour over coffee. It has incredible flavor. 

I usually drink my coffee black so this was no different but I could taste so much depth and flavor that I've missed from comparable gourmet coffee places. 


I happened to be starving so I had one of their scones. It was very good but I'm not sure how objective I was in the moment haha. 

Overall, don't miss this spot - I'm very lucky that it's nearby but it's worth the trip. My one complaint is that it's not really conducive to working or holding a coffee meeting with someone. The seating is quite limited.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
Great coffee, miserable staff who clearly don't want to be there. 

Coffee is 5 star but staff ruin the experience. Who the hell manages this place?
author: Ian V.

description: Ah man. Wrecking Ball you are so cute inside, I wanted to love you but I don't. So I order a latte and a cortado. The latte was serviceable but nothing to speak of. And the cortado was served in a large cup just a tiny bit smaller than the latte. It tasted like a small latte. Correct me if I'm wrong, but a cortado is usually served in a very small cup and the espresso/milk proportions are different than just a small latte. It was really weird. They look like they know what they're doing so maybe it's just their odd way of making one. Anyway, I would not return because of this.
author: Ari R.

description: Good coffee, small spot with cute decoration and pineapple wallpaper for "selfie" background .
author: Ilma D.

description: if you enjoy paying $5 for a lukewarm latte while receiving indifferent service, this is your kind of place. It seems like all the owner's time and money went into creating an extremely attractive visual experience (beautiful packaging, lighting, shelving, etc.) but little or no effort to provide customers with a friendly experience and good drinks.
author: Cal M.

description:
Is $4 for ice coffee where we are now?

Cute little spot for your caffeine fix. Definitely too expensive to make this spot a habit, but I appreciate that it isn't Starbucks. Very friendly service, but I feel this place belongs in the mission. 

PS they have a small cute selection of home goods: notepaper, stickers etc.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
Situation 
- I ordered a cappuccino to go 

Pros
- The cappuccino was tasty
- They take credit cards
- Great service 
- Nice decor

Cons
- Limited seating
author: Dipesh G.

description: Very local feeling coffee place. Limited menu but overall the selection is good. Seating is also limited. Would come back on a nice day to sit outside.
author: Ale P.

description: I liked the environment, and the first smoky sip of my Karl the Fog latte. but it was kind of lukewarm and the flavor got old (would have been better as a sample). And it took frikkin forever to get my hands on it.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I am from Portland and am a major coffee snob and this place is is my favorite coffee shop in all of SF. I buy the beans and make French press with their coffee every day. Their beans are fresh with a sweet aroma. So good  

This is also my favorite coffee shop because of their establishment. The baristas are very friendly and it is always clean in there. 

Plus they have great chocolate chip cookies which pair well with their pour overs :)

Highly recommend.
author: Maggie P.

description:
Small, trendy, great coffee shop off Union close to neighborhood parking (don't pay meter if you don't have to!). If you like taking pictures of your foam, I'd definitely come to this spot. I don't generally stay at the shop for a while, it's much more of a "grab-and-go" vibe as there's limited seating inside with a few cute tables outside. 

I'm mostly a latte drinker, but I'd recommend trying the iced cappuccino at least once.

I live a few blocks away so it's safe to say I've been here quite a few times, and I have yet to have a negative experience. The service is always friendly, and I like that they're usually really into their work.
author: G R.

description: Neat little coffee bar. Their use of an oddly shaped and tiny space is quite creative and works. Definitely aiming for the coffee snob crowd, something I'm aspiring to be (just started roasting my own beans!). I had a pleasant tasting macchiato and will stop in again next time I'm in the hood. They also had a good looking plate of pastries, but this place is mostly about the bean.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Yes! Oh San Francisco, I'm so glad your trendy coffee shops aren't like Los Angeles ones. New Years Day, our buddy took us into the city and saw we needed some coffee to pick us up. 

I'm not too big of a fan of fancy coffees anymore as I'm trying to cut my sugar content down and I actually enjoy the taste of coffee, not cream and sugar
. 
I got myself a basic pour, black, HOLY CRAP! Delicious, very very very smooth and mellow. No bitter taste to it. So glad these beans weren't burnt like how I feel every single coffee shop that's popped up in LA does. So acidic, sour, bitter and oily it's so gross. 


+
If you like coffee, this is for you!
This place could probably convert you sacrilegious cream and sugar pourers to the dark side. TRY IT OUT
author: Tommy L.

description: I love this place and it's coffee normally. I have had such great coffee here but not today. Today I got lukewarm coffee and attitude. I said my cappuccino was lukewarm and was told they had no microwave with which to heat it up. Seriously. He then said that the correct temperature for cappuccino was 135, then held my cup and declared it to be at the correct temperature. No attempt to offer a remake especially when I was obviously not happy. The owners are famous for their trips into "country" and helping out the small farmers - I am sure they would be horrified with this stupidity
author: Don R.

description:
Small but adorable space with amazing coffee. I recently moved to the area and decided to check this place out after reading all of the reviews and I must say that Wrecking Ball did not disappoint.

The space is small but quaint and as everyone else mentioned, the pineapple wallpaper is super cute. Bummed I didn't get a picture of it like others...but then again, I will be back. 

As for the coffee, I went for the Almond Milk latte. Most places don't make almond milk lattes or they aren't that good but Wrecking Ball's was amazing. The barista made sure to tell me how many shots of espresso were in each size to see if I'd want more or less and the amount of milk they typically use. 

You may have to wait a few minutes longer than other coffee shops but it is definitely worth it and you know they're taking their time and doing it right for every cup!
author: Kelly J.

description: My new favorite cafe in the Marina. Extra points for awesome wallpaper. My only rec would be to go during off-hours, otherwise you'll wait forever for your drink and there won't be any seats for you. Enjoy!
author: Erin W.

description: I came here in the evening before dinner in the Marina. I ordered the mocha and it was perfect and the latte art was beautiful! I have a new appreciation for latte art after trying to make my own at home and failing. There isn't a lot of seating in this coffee shop but there are about four chairs in front of where the baristas prepare the coffee if you want to watch. I am a huge fan of Rifle Paper Co. and the pineapple wallpaper is perfect! I also love the wrecking ball logo and the entire design of this coffee shop.
author: Karen L.

description: After wandering around the Marina by myself for a fairly long time, I had COMPLETELY forgotten that Wrecking Ball Coffee was an option before I had my cooking class at Sur La Table across the street. Unfortunately for me, I walked in JUST as they were about to close for the day, so I wasn't able to sit and enjoy the cute and very charming shop for very long.  I had one of their single origin pour overs, and to be honest, I was a little surprised with how much it was (I think it was over $4). That being said, it was my first time having coffee made with the Kalita and the coffee itself was delicious.  I would definitely like to come back here and try some of their other options and stay awhile!
author: Lisa I.

description:
"[You] came in like a wrecking ball / I never hit so hard in love."

You could easily miss this place, if you're just walking by. However, my attention was immediately drawn to the sign that said "COFFEE," so I thought I would try this new place on Union Street (it opened 3 weeks ago).

Wrecking Ball combines the atmosphere of Jane on Fillmore and the excellent coffee quality of Saint Frank to make my new favorite place to grab a cappuccino!

The wallpaper... Oh, my goodness. It has pineapples on it! Adorable, golden pineapples! Excuse me while I take a million photos for Instagram.

And the coffee? On point. They brew their own!
author: Gabriela K.

description:
I stopped by this coffee shop while I was in San Francisco. The shop has a nice all white decor and has a large espresso machine right behind the bar. The prices were reasonable and the staff was friendly. One of the baristas talked to me about how this company coined the term "third wave coffee".

The store features drip coffee and espresso drinks as well as small snacks.

One of the baristas was trying to impress some hot babes by talking about how much he drank over the weekend, that was a little obnoxious but it wasn't a big deal.

The espresso I ordered was truly excellent. The barista was sure to take extra time measuring and preparing the shot.

The only qualm I have is that the roaster was not on site. I assumed there would be a roaster at the location because of the name of the business. I prefer the look and smell of the roaster as well as the ability to talk to the roaster.

Overall an excellent location, you should stop by to try some amazing espresso if you get the chance.
author: Joseph N.

description: Really good coffee. Need I say more? Located on the boutique-y Union Street in Cow Hollow lies this teeny tiny hole-in-the-wall coffee shop. From the outside, it looks very unassuming...but don't be fooled because the coffee here is no joke. I'm not sure what kind of coffee they are using, but it was pretty damn tasty. It's quick, convenient, and so much better than illy which is also close by. It definitely has that hipster vibe with their intentionally brewed coffee and their pineapple wallpaper. 5/5 would recommend for anyone who is walking around the area.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
Stumbled upon this adorable simplistic coffee shop. I'm glad i did. The latte was well balanced and full of coffee goodness...it had almost a pumpkin flavor to it (not pumpkin spice, EW, just plain pumpkin, Yum!). Or I could just be trippin...

I'll definitely stop by again when I'm in the area.
author: Gina G.

description: Adorable hole in the wall coffee place with really really good coffee drinks. When you order at the register, the fact that you can see into the alleyway to all the garbage does make me a little skeptical but that's really my only complaint. Would definitely come back for an almond milk latte or cortado
author: Diana A.

description: Awesome! My favorite coffee in the marina (besides St. Frank).  Almond milk latte is the best I have had. My boyfriend is super into coffee and loved their Ethiopian pour over. Really nice staff, great at explaining all of the different coffees and preparations. Not a lot of room to sit and work on a laptop inside but a great setting for catching with a friend. The tables and chairs outside are a nice addition too - perfect for union st people watching.
author: Shannon W.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood! I'm so glad to live near here. A definite A+ recommendation from me!
author: Emily L.

description:
This small cafe is easy to miss if you are driving but definitely not if you're walking around the area. The sweet aroma of their coffee drew me in from across the street. 

Their cappuccino is very good! (But price is a bit steep) And the staff are all very friendly and inviting. This place is good for coffee-to-go because of the limited seating but don't forget to take a pineapple selfie before you leave :P
author: Norine L.

description: I never thought the world needed another coffee roaster until I tried their mocha.  Their coffee is really unsurpassed and peerless. Pricy, but everything from the milk to chocolate is top of the line.
author: Andre L.

description: Great coffee, nice staff, cute decor in an adorable neighborhood! I got a latte and it was really good! It was empty the two times I had gone but it's on a quiet corner so it's a nice little hidden gem. Also make sure to take a picture with the cute pineapple wallpaper
author: Zara S.

description: This place is great! Super trendy and friendly customer service. I ordered a hot chocolate since I'm not much of a coffee drinker. It was delicious! My friend and I dined in and sat at the counter to watch how they make their drip coffee (which is fascinating!). While I was drinking my hot chocolate, the barista offered to top off my drink after I had taken a couple of sips. The pineapple wallpaper is a plus! There are many instagram worthy opportunities here.
author: Shazia V.

description:
I almost don't want to review this place because I feel like it's still sort of a hidden gem on Union, but that would not be fair to you all, would it?

This place is not only adorable, it has amazing coffee. I always go with the almond milk latte, but everything I've seen them makes looks delightful and made with a little l-o-v-e. 

Definitely worth checking out! Their pastries look amazing too.
author: Jane F.

description:
One of the best coffees- my husband stated.

Cute wallpaper, cute seating outside. It's a must stop when you're in the area and would like a great pour over
author: Amalie A.

description: Came here for a first cup of coffee at a roastery in SF. It's a small shop without a lot of sitting room but a great cup of coffee and a sweet pineapple wallpaper wall. If you're in the neighborhood stop by!
author: Matthew W.

description: I don't drink coffee but when I do I only drink the Mocha from Wrecking Ball! The staff is super friendly and knows their stuff. I still haven't found a place that makes a good mocha!  :)
author: Fanny C.

description: Great spot with very enjoyable coffee... could enjoy the coffee drinks at a slightly hotter temp. Was a delightful spot to sit at the coffee counter with a friend. The design fits the union/marina crowd, so a bit on trend focused, but was comfortable and friendly enough. Good spot!
author: J K.

description:
It's very hard to impress a girl who loves her coffee. 

But man o man, this place is the real deal. I needed a pick me up after my flight and came here. This place is amazing. 

Can't wait to try it again.
author: Aidan V.

description: Friendly service, trendy decor and tasty lattes. Only thing I thought was strange was that I asked for an iced latte and they couldn't make it because they were out of ice.. Weird but the hot latte was delicious.
author: Cara S.

description: First time here, and me and my boyfriend were both surprised by their coffee. I like their latte.It's pretty smooth, and tasted great. Not too dark, not too light. Very fresh experience!
author: Ihsuan Y.

description:
Amazing coffee. Great service. No-nonsense perfection. Do yourself a favor and make Wrecking Ball your go-to neighborhood coffee spot. I have a hard time thinking of a better latte in the city. 

Every time I come here it is often the best decision I make all day.
author: Adrian P.

description: The coffee here is pretty tasty but don't take your laptop! No wifi or places to sit and work.
author: Candi M.

description: real, real good cortado. pricey,  but I always think it's kind of worth it to spend a bit on a good cuppa. also super cute (waterproof!) stickers for purchase :)
author: Holly C.

description:
The perfect blend of great coffee and atmosphere! 

The pineapple wallpaper makes for the perfect insta background and the almond milk latte was delicious - the baristas were really sweet and friendly

*similar vibe as Alfred in LA but a lot more low key
author: Amanda D.

description: Unfortunately, not spacious for sitting and enjoying this quaint gem of a cafe. I lve their coffee very much. Also they have good taste in wallpaper .
author: Grace C.

description:
The latte I had here recently was fabulous. From the richness of the espresso to the creaminess of the milk and density of the foam, the latte was perfect in every regard. 

I ended up at Wrecking Ball when Rapha closed early on New Year's Eve, and the guys closing up recommended Wrecking Ball. I usually go to Rapha because I am only out this way when I am biking -- and I can easily park my bike inside Rapha without having to carry a lock. The gal working that morning at Wrecking Ball was also totally cool with my bringing my bicycle inside, at least while I ordered and got my drink. 

I happened to be the only customer when I walked in, so service was obviously fast in that case. I was grateful for the table outside, where I sipped my latte and took in that last calm morning of 2014.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Visited on Saturday, 2/7

Almost liked this place (latte was good!), but the service was very bad. Two of the three baristas refused to talk to or look at me or my wife, even though we engaged them. I asked a couple of questions to get their attention, and they finally looked up and stared, without answering. When I ordered, the young lady at the register didn't say a single word. 

We stuck around to try and relax, but they played heavy metal music on blast. 

Other observation: the two baristas (young ladies) who refused to help us, also refused to help their co-worker (a young man). He tried asking them for help on an order at one point, and one of the the girls went to the back to turn up the heavy metal more. 

Bad service, very loud music, limited seating, good coffee.
author: Michael C.

description:
This place is on point.  Been waiting for them to open the Union street location for months and it finally happened!  Their coffee is of the highest quality, their employees on very cool & knowledgeable, and they take their craft to the next level (just check their Instagram to see how nerdy they are about coffee equipment). 

Best coffee in the marina hands down.
author: Luke N.

description:
We got 2 soy latte, 2 pastries and sat at the table.

The latte foam was very creamy, the scone I didn't like as much. But come here for the Marla buns, really like the spices they add to it.
author: Tony T.

description: Very cute little coffee shop! While the coffee was good, the service was bit snobby. Probably won't be back just for that reason.
author: Mikayla R.

description:
Adorable coffee shop with delicious coffee and friendly staff. Like everyone else, I love the wallpaper! 

VERY tiny and can get quite crowded - definitely a popular spot for young parents...every time I go in there are no less than two giant strollers taking up 99% of the store.
author: Anna S.

description:
Probably the only speciality coffee joint serving the severely underserved Marina. Their beans pass the test. Prettttty decent.

Now if only it were closer to my work so I wouldn't try so many other disappointing coffee around the marina. Eventually I will just walk the 20 min for a cap since there is nothing on Chestnut.
author: Allen P.

description: If you appreciate amazing artisan coffee and you are in San Francisco, you must get here.  Simply one of the best macchiatos I have ever had.  Expertly crafted with unbelievable depth of flavor.  Tiny little store front that is easy to miss if you are not paying attention.  A true gem that is not to be missed.
author: Pete L.

description: Stopped in for an afternoon espresso and treated myself to a salted chocolate chip cookie. The espresso was strong, earthy, and a bit smoky. Great flavor and intensity. The cookie was good too, not too big, with lots of smaller dark chocolate chunks distributed throughout with a good chip to dough ration. The fleur de sell on top really amped up the sweetness and richness. The ladies behind the counter were friendly, the ship was small but cozy, and overall this was a great place to stop in for a post lunch pick me up.
author: Arugula F.

description:
Best cappuccino I've ever had...by far.

And they don't  charge extra for soy milk?! Wish it was in my neighborhood.
author: Chris S.

description: The smell coming from the street is amazing. Over priced coffee. The coffee tasted burnt like it was over roasted. They have cheap chairs and tables to sit on our front, but they fall over.  Friendly staff.
author: Kait B.

description: Love this place! Perfectly made cortado. The  converted garage is unique and playful-as were the pineapple wall paper and the two baristas. But it's gotta be about the coffee and my stylish, delish drink was a perfect pick me up in the mid afternoon.
author: A B.

description: Coffee wasn't too great, especially for the price and size. Very cool and trendy decor.Staff was not the friendliest. This seems more like a place for locals, not such a tourity spot to go.
author: Marley K.

description: I always stop in at Wrecking Ball if I'm in the area, and if I'm not I trek over just for their Iced Cappuccino. Make sure to try a sip before stirring, it's delicious and one of the best iced coffees I've ever had. Definitely a must try in Cow's Hollow. Also their pineapple wallpaper is adorable.
author: Janet B.

description: I ordered the iced brew and walked away with something that tasted more like an iced latte.  I generally drink my coffee black, but this was a pretty good treat.  Besides the taste, I dug the buzz.  I walked away humming "What a Wonderful World" - no doubt it was the coffee.
author: Rayna A.

description: Awesome baristas and fun people working behind the counter. Would absolutely recommend the Cortado.  I hope they stick around for a while.
author: Megan M.

description: Wrecking Ball is a solid coffee shop in the Marina district of the city.  They are the city's distributor of Kalita products and their owner's name, Nick, is sexy as hell.  I had the pleasure of talking to Brenna and Jose while I was there and not only does Jose makes a mean pourover, he's funny and easy to talk to.  If I lived closer to Wrecking Ball it would probably be my home base shop. I haven't been able to go back in some time, but I definitely will be going back to buy a bag of beans.  Probably one of the must stop spots to grab a cup and hang out. The store is small, homey and the interior design of the shop is A1.  The pourover station is one of the nicest ones I've seen so far too.
author: Nick F.

description: Cold brew was, meh. Asked for a pour over iced and they said, we don't do that here. Cute space which could improve by providing alternative iced options.
author: Ian S.

description:
Excellent cup of coffee! I live in the East Bay but hadn't heard of wrecking ball until I ran into their beans on a recent trip to Portland. Decided to look them up when I was in the city and I was not disappointed. Excellent drip cup Yirgachefe and found out that they sell the beans at bi-rite. Still haven't seen their beans in the East Bay, but I'm excited for their new shop to open on Union in SF. 

The above is a review for the coffee but wow the bakery the current shop is tied to is excellent also. I had a coffee cake infused with cardamom and it honestly tasted like eating Arabic roasted yellow coffee with cardamom and ginger that you can find in the Gulf.... Perfect with my cup of Wrecking ball, I'll be back!
author: Dustin C.

description: This is a great tucked away little coffee shop right on Union. They have a really nice selection of coffee and have an almost scientific approach to coffee making. You can sit at the counter but this is really a grab and go kind of spot.
author: Brian H.

description:
Been to many coffee shops in the city and this place is at the top of my list!

First for the atmosphere, cute, small and clean space. 

Second for the service. The barista was very friendly and engaged in conversation!

Third for the food and coffee! Got a savory croissant, a cappuccino and an espresso! All delicious! My shot was bright and sweet! Tasted great in milk!

Definitely would come back!
author: JZ V.

description:
Great place to get quality pour over coffee in the Marina / Cow Hollow area. I have enjoyed all of their single origin coffees at home as well as prepared in the store. Their coffee is one of the best in the immediate area so I am always willing to take a bit of a detour to stop by as I am going about my day.

The location is small, but they do have a few places to sit inside and out.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Blue ribbon.

Symbolizes high quality: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_ribbon

Sipping high quality: http://shop.wreckingballcoffee.com/product/kenya

Chosen based on the recommendation it would be the lightest and smoothest of the pour overs. Indeed it was. Nonfat milk in a blue ribbon adorned bottle was a nice touch.

Sis enjoyed her latte. Together they were $8.50 which certainly isn't cheap in the world of caffeine. But expect to pay a premium when that caffeine comes from Kenya.

Exposed pipes, surprisingly subdued pineapple wallpaper and eye catching coffee machinery add to the otherwise stark white decor. Staff was patient and full of knowledge.

Also full of stars.
author: Jason B.

description: I love their coffee. The baristas are VERY knowledgeable and very friendly. Not to mention, they have really cool latte art. I saw one of the barista make a bear. CRAZY I love bears. Great coffee and great people.
author: Adam O.

description: Love all the Baristas that work here! They know what they are talking about and have patience with someone as indecisive as me... Of course the Pineapple wall is now legendary, but it really is the cutest wall paper I think I have ever seen :) Wish it was less packed on the weekends but great for grabbing a cup on a week day!
author: Tina S.

description: I can't believe this coffee shop is in Cow Hollow/ Marina! It was a great find, and could definitely see this type of place doing well in Soma or the Mission. It's got a lot of charm, yummy looking pastries and great coffee! The vibe is PDX or Berlin worthy.
author: Bethany D.

description: Hip, spare and modern. Not your typical cozy brown shop. Very tiny. Limited food selection. I felt 20 years too old when I walked in. That said, gracious, friendly staff and...wow! The tea and hot chocolate both on point and outstanding! I can't speak for the coffee, but I appreciate a coffee-centric shop with high standards for their tea, and their hot chocolate, too. Lovely shop.
author: Sylvan B.

description: Wrecking Ball was recommended to me by a friend that lives in the area. It's quite small, but so cute. I got the Marla bun (I think bun) and an ice brewed coffee, both were so good
author: Carly K.

description: SUPER HIPSTER cave-like shop. cappuccino is smooth and mellow - awesome quality. bomb pastries. delish boiled eggs.
author: Jenn H.

description: Cute hidden coffee spot on Union Street. Had an iced cappuccino today...it was so good didn't even need sugar or any sweetener. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Definitely will be back...like tomorrow !
author: Sfgal S.

description: Super cute neighborhood coffee shop. Love the Rifle Paper Co wallpaper. I've tried the iced coffee and the latte. The latte was especially good! There is no space to work here, which is sort of annoying.
author: Jillian P.

description: Perfect cortado. The place is small. In fact very small with 4 chairs searing counter. Service was friendly and personable. We will beck when we are back n the area.
author: StoryTeller D.

description:
Yes yes yes

Delish espresso drinks made with precision and care
Ditto the pour over stuff
Friendly staff
Beautiful small space
Outdoor seating
Not a place for laptop zombies
HARD BOILED EGGS!!!  A nice alternative to the ubiquitous carb and sugar pastry bombs that is our only alternative at many places 

They obviously know what they r doing.
author: Troy B.

description: Coming from the coffee capital of Australia, and my experience in the coffee industry in Melbourne, I have to say this place has THE BEST COFFEE IN CALIFORNIA! We searched far and wide and landed here. Thank you for the amazing coffee, I cannot recommended more.
author: Brittany P.

description:
interesting place.
Coffee nerd mecca vs attempt at luxury item for the affluent neighborhood? 
I guess this shop is not ushering gentrification. reverse gentrification?

I was sorry not to run into proprietor and controversial coffee nerd celebrity Nick Cho when I finally visited the shop recently.  Perhaps he could have more efficiently brewed cups of coffee with the Japanese Kalita Wave-dripper pour over cones he so champions. 
There was something a little strange going on here.
